items.q: Which country sent an Armada to attack England in 1588?
items.explanation: The Spanish Armada was defeated by the English navy and storms.

items.q: Queen Victoria ruled the British Empire during the 19th century.
items.explanation: The Victorian era was named after her reign (1837-1901).

items.q: The printing press was invented in the 20th century.
items.explanation: Johannes Gutenberg invented it in the 15th century.

items.q: What is the collective name for the first 10 amendments to the US Constitution?
items.explanation: They guarantee individual liberties like freedom of speech.

items.q: Who led the French army to several victories during the Hundred Years' War before being burned at the stake?
items.explanation: She is a national heroine of France.

items.q: Which US president dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki to end WWII?
items.explanation: This decision forced Japan to surrender in 1945.

What type of massive graves did ancient Egyptian Pharaohs build?

items.q: What title was given to the rulers of imperial Russia before 1917?
items.explanation: Nicholas II was the last Tsar.
